intro: Rubus aromaticus, commonly known as the aromatic raspberry, is a species of bramble native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red or yellow in color. It thrives in temperate climates and prefers well-drained soil. The leaves and fruits of Rubus aromaticus contain aromatic compounds that contribute to its distinctive scent.
